summary: The Kidney Care Access Protection Act aims to improve access to innovative treatments for end-stage renal disease (ESRD) under Medicare. It extends transitional drug add-on payments, establishes permanent post-TDAPA adjustments for certain drugs, clarifies the definition of renal dialysis services, and revises payments for new and innovative equipment and supplies. The bill also ensures Medicare Advantage supports these innovative therapies. A key component addresses staffing barriers with ESRD market basket labor adjustments to improve payment accuracy.
